221.input:
time: 2017-10-30 
 author: Megan Willett-Wei 
 source: http://uk.businessinsider.com/former-bachelor-staffer-sexual-harassment-allegations-2017-10 
 text: Former "Bachelor" producer Becky Steenhoek filed a complaint in the Los Angeles Superior Court alleging sexual harassment on-set.

She says she was asked uncomfortable questions about her sex life and grooming habits.

The suit names five producers, the show's production company Warner Bros., and "Bachelor" creator Mike Fleiss' production company NZK Productions.

In the world of reality dating shows, talking about your past relationships and sex life is par for the course, but few would think that extended to the show's producers.

Advertisement

Yet that's exactly what a former segment producer for "The Bachelor" claims happened to her in a new complaint against Warner Bros., which produces the show.

Becky Steenhoek ‚Äî who worked on the production for the 2016 season of "The Bachelorette" with JoJo Fletcher ‚Äî filed a lawsuit on Monday in the Los Angeles Superior Court and spoke with the Los Angeles Times about what occurred between her and five other producers, who were also named along with Warner Bros. in the complaint.

Steenhoek, 31, says that the show's executive and cast producers named in the complaint would ask her personal questions that were extremely sexual in nature, including about her personal grooming habits, sex life, and masturbation.

Related stories

"You could visibly tell it was very uncomfortable to me to witness, just because they did make comments like, 'Oh, Becky's blushing,' or 'Her ears are probably burning,'" Steenhoek told The Times, adding that her colleagues' questions made her uncomfortable.

Advertisement

When she asked her female coworker Caitlin Stapleton ‚Äî a cast producer on the show ‚Äî what to do about it, Steenhoek said Stapleton told her that was just "the way of the industry and world that we work in," adding that the behavior was "locker-room talk" and a way to bond.

Steenhoek said after confiding in Stapleton, her job markedly changed from attending production meetings to fetching meals for her bosses before being told she wasn't needed for the remainder of the season. When she asked why, she said she was told it was because she wasn't enough of a "bitch."

Steenhoek was a producer on Fletcher's season of "The Bachelorette." ABC

Steenhoek is now suing Warner Bros., "Bachelor" creator Mike Fleiss' production company NZK Productions, as well as producers Elan Gale, Peter Scalettar, Jacqueline Naz Perez, Bennett Graebner, and Stapleton for "damages related to sexual harassment and hostile work environment, sex discrimination, retaliation, failure to prevent harassment, intentional infliction of emotional distress and wrongful termination," according to the LA Times.

In a statement to INSIDER, Warner Bros. said it had previously investigated Steenhoek's claims and didn't feel their findings supported her claims. Read the full statement below:

Advertisement

"We take all allegations of workplace harassment very seriously. These allegations were brought to our attention and were thoroughly investigated earlier this year. Our findings did not support the plaintiff‚Äôs characterization of the events claimed to have taken place, which is why we are disappointed by the filing of this lawsuit."

Steenhoek's lawsuit comes at a time when powerful industry players in Hollywood like producer Harvey Weinstein or director James Toback are being accused of sexual harassment. And it's not just in Hollywood ‚Äî many powerful men are now being accused of sexual misconduct, including Ben Affleck and Kevin Spacey.

This inclusion of the response from the accused party adds balance to the article and provides readers with multiple perspectives on the issue.

time: 2017-10-31 
 author: Jenna Lemoncelli 
 source: https://web.archive.org/web/20171101195044/http://hollywoodlife.com/2017/11/01/are-kim-kardashian-kanye-west-divorcing-split-break-up-baby-number-3/ 
 text: Trouble in paradise? ‚Äî It seems so for Kim Kardashian and Kanye West. Kim has reportedly made the decision to file for divorce from Yeezy and is ‚Äòready to move on‚Äô with her life. Her alleged decision stemmed from his 2016 hospitalization.

Kim Kardashian, 37, will be filing for divorce from Kanye West, 40, Life & Style reports, adding that ‚Äúit‚Äôs officially over‚Äù between the power couple. ‚ÄúShe is ready to move on with her life,‚Äù an insider tells the mag. After Ye‚Äôs 2016 hospitalization, where reports claimed he suffered a mental breakdown, the source says that things only got worse with his ‚Äúerratic behavior.‚Äù Upon his release from UCLA Medical Center [back in Nov. 2016], Kanye‚Äôs felt ‚Äúspied on,‚Äù by Kim, which has caused him to come distant, as reported by the mag. ‚ÄúKanye will go days without talking to her. He‚Äôs hot and he‚Äôs cold. Even their sex life isn‚Äôt what it used to be.‚Äù

The mag goes on to report that Kanye is hiding dark secrets, that only Kim knows about. Around the time of his hospitalization, he told Kim about his alleged drug use, which involved both liquid and traditional marajuana among other substances, a second source claims. Despite Kim‚Äôs rep denying the divorce report, Life & Style still continues to report that the couple is struggling. The mag claims that Kanye doesn‚Äôt trust anyone and that the pair has recently been fighting over him spending time away from Kim and the kids ‚Äî North, 4, and Saint, 1. Kimye are also expecting their third child together, via surrogate, as Kim has been vocal about issues with her past pregnancies. The source adds that ‚ÄúKim was hoping this baby would bring them closer, but it hasn‚Äôt.‚Äù

Kim and Kanye recently jetted off to Utah for a weekend getaway for her 37th birthday; a trip that mag claims was a ‚Äúbust‚Äù because Kim was bored the entire time, despite Ye‚Äô loving it. Ultimately, ‚Äúshe‚Äôs tired and she‚Äôs done with this marriage,‚Äù the insider says. ‚ÄúKanye makes it very difficult for her. She loves being a mother, but she wants it all and Kanye can‚Äôt give that to her‚Ä¶ Kim definitely wants out of the marriage.‚Äù The mag also claims that even with a third child on the way, Kim is set on her alleged decision to leave Ye‚Äô.

Kim and Kanye have yet to address the divorce reports. The pair looked happier than ever at her 37th birthday dinner with her friends and family on Oct. 26. Ye‚Äô sang ‚ÄúHappy Birthday‚Äù to Kim, with the rest of her loved ones, and she documented the entire night. And, the countless, loving videos didn‚Äôt hint at a split if you ask us!

HollywoodLifers, do you really think Kimye are splitting?

time: 2017-07-10 
 author: Lara Sophia 
 source: https://web.archive.org/web/20170916020930/http://www.allabouttrh.com/2017/07/11/vicki-gunvalson-reflects-brooks-ayers-drama-wasnt-monster/ 
 text: Vicki Gunvalson may have a new man in her life, but it seems like she just can‚Äôt quit talking about her ex-Brooks Ayers.

While out promoting the twelfth season of the Real Housewives of Orange County Vicki had a message for fans about her ex.

‚ÄúHe wasn‚Äôt this monster in my life. He wasn‚Äôt. The viewers may think he was, but he wasn‚Äôt,‚Äù Vicki explained to E! News. ‚ÄúDid he turn into a monster towards the end? He did a lot of weird ass crazy things that I still don‚Äôt understand because I don‚Äôt talk to him.‚Äù

She added, ‚ÄúI don‚Äôt know why he did what he did, but he wasn‚Äôt a monster. He wasn‚Äôt really the man I thought he was if he did what he did to me.‚Äù

In fact, Vicki says if she could talk to Brooks one on one she‚Äôd ask him one question: why?

‚ÄúWhy did you reveal bad records? Why did you do what you did to me?‚Äù Vicki explained. ‚ÄúWe had a good thing going, or so I thought, but why? I still don‚Äôt know why. I‚Äôve never been able to get the answer from him.‚Äù

If you don‚Äôt remember Brooks faked cancer and showed off fake cancer documents to the media and Vicki‚Äôs RHOC co-stars in hopes of shutting down doubts about his health.

Ultimately, it was revealed that Brooks never had cancer and was never treated by City of Hope Medical Center.

And to make matters worse, Vicki called her relationship with Brooks ‚Äúgreat‚Äù in the RHOC season 12 premiere. Gag!

Oh, Vicki. Somehow I feel like Vicki isn‚Äôt fully over Brooks and I don‚Äôt think she ever will be. Why is she still talking about him? No one cares. And anything Vicki says about Brooks isn‚Äôt going to change people‚Äôs minds about Brooks or her possible involvement in his cancer scam. It‚Äôs a shame Vicki can‚Äôt seem to forget Brooks especially when her new boyfriends seems so great. I want Vicki to be happy, and I think she is with her new man so I wish she‚Äôd just close the chapter on Brooks. You know, outta sight outta mind.

Thoughts on Vicki‚Äôs interview? Why do you think Vicki still talks about Brooks? Was Brooks a monster? Do you believe Vicki never knew anything about Brooks cancer scam? Was Vicki‚Äôs relationship with Brooks ‚Äúgreat?‚Äù Does Vicki need to stop talking about Brooks?

Follow AllAboutTRH On Instagram.

Follow AllAboutTRH On Twitter.

Like AllAboutTRH On Facebook.

Follow the AllAboutTRH Podcast on iTunes & Soundcloud ‚Äì Remember to Rate, Comment & Subscribe!

225.input:
time: 2012-08-16 
 author: David Amsden 
 source: www.nytimes.com/2012/08/17/t-magazine/miranda-kerr-goes-kiwi.html 
 text: Miranda Kerr was 18, just out of high school, a girl from the Australian countryside curious about what the rest of the world had to offer, when she first visited New Zealand. Along with a close friend from Gunnedah, the pastoral town where she grew up, Kerr set out to experience what for many is the draw of New Zealand: to escape and explore, to get a little lost and, in the process, get a little found. They slept in a tent. Swam in natural hot springs. Hiked terrain so raw and depopulated and expansive it felt as if they were the first humans to discover it. Kerr didn‚Äôt know it at the time, but her life would change significantly in the years that followed, thanks largely to her enviable genetic gifts: the long pale legs, the shimmering doe eyes and, most famously, the pert, dimpled cheeks that have made her one of the highest paid, most recognizable models in the world. Modeling, for Kerr, has been its own sort of adventure, one she will be the first to acknowledge as a stroke of good fortune not to be taken for granted. ‚ÄúStill, that backpacking trip, just having that freedom, was one of the best times in my life,‚Äù Kerr recently reflected. ‚ÄúEver since, I‚Äôve wanted to get back to New Zealand.‚Äù

For seven months, beginning last December, Kerr, 29, got her wish. She spent the majority of her nonworking time in Wellington, New Zealand‚Äôs capital, where her husband, Orlando Bloom, was filming ‚ÄúThe Hobbit,‚Äù Peter Jackson‚Äôs two-part prequel to the epic ‚ÄúThe Lord of the Rings‚Äù trilogy, the films that first made Bloom a star a decade ago. Wellington ‚Äî or ‚ÄúWellywood,‚Äù as it‚Äôs been christened since Jackson set up his studio empire in the suburb of Miramar ‚Äî is one of the most remote capitals on the planet: some 28 hours by plane from London, 23 from New York, 15 from Los Angeles, 14 hours from Hong Kong and Tokyo. Of the city‚Äôs many charms ‚Äî its burgeoning restaurant scene, its absurdly picturesque scenery, the mellow Kiwi hospitality you experience everywhere you go ‚Äî it is Wellington‚Äôs physical isolation that makes it such a singular place. During the week I spent in the city, no matter what I was doing, even something as simple as sitting at a cafe sipping a flat white (New Zealand‚Äôs richer version of a latte), I felt a palpable remove from the ways and rhythms of the rest of the world. (Being on the other side of the international date line helps.) So while much of Wellington could be compared to, say, Portland, Ore., or Seattle, there is the added seduction of being pleasantly unmoored, able to take in the pleasure of civilization while existing outside of it.

The circumstances of Kerr‚Äôs stay in Wellington were, of course, quite different from her initial visit. She is now the mother of a cherubic young son, Flynn, 19 months, and the tent of her teen years was replaced by an airy, seaside mansion where every window looks out on Wellington Harbour. (The house, lent to the couple by one of the film‚Äôs producers, happens to be where Bloom celebrated his 22nd birthday while filming ‚ÄúTLOTR.‚Äù) If she wanted to run an errand, or head to an afternoon Pilates class, a production assistant gave her a ride. Sweet perks, no question. And yet, to hear Kerr tell it, the life she and Bloom carved out in Wellington was in many ways a reminder of what existence was like before she became a celebrity, a kind of geographic escape hatch from the scrutiny of tabloids and the curious eyes of strangers. When they first arrived, for instance, they took a road trip that was reminiscent of her earlier journey: aimlessly driving around the countryside, out of reach and out of touch. ‚ÄúWe didn‚Äôt camp because Flynn‚Äôs still a little young for that,‚Äù Kerr told me. ‚ÄúBut it was just the three of us, nothing to do except be with each other in this shockingly beautiful place.‚Äù

Kerr and I were having this conversation at Wellington‚Äôs Botanic Garden, a sprawling expanse of lush floral curiosities, manicured lawns and shaded labyrinthine walkways offering some of the most extraordinary views of the city. It was hard to imagine that this was the same woman who, a few months earlier, had walked the runway in a $2.5 million bra while Maroon 5 performed at the Victoria‚Äôs Secret fashion show; here, in raw-denim jeans and a loose navy sweater, she seemed no different from the other health-conscious young mothers who made up most of the gardens‚Äô visitors. Kerr had come from the set of ‚ÄúThe Hobbit,‚Äù which she visited most days with Flynn when Bloom, who was reprising his role as the bow-wielding elf Legolas, was working. ‚ÄúThere‚Äôs a cafeteria where everyone eats lunch, and they‚Äôre all in full makeup,‚Äù Kerr said. ‚ÄúSo you see these poor Orcs‚Äù ‚Äî the demonic goblin soldiers of the film ‚Äî ‚Äútrying to eat without ruining their costumes. For Orlando, it‚Äôs easier. He just has the blond wig and the pointy ears.‚Äù

 text: She didn‚Äôt get a TV romance, but Bachelor alum Britt Nilsson found her real-life Prince Charming.

Nilsson, who appeared on Chris Soules‚Äò season of The Bachelor in 2015 and later faced-off against Kaitlyn Bristowe for the lead of season 11 of The Bachelorette, married Jeremy Byrne on Saturday.

The bride wore a strapless gown and long veil for their outdoor ceremony in southern California, according to photos shared on social media by friends and family with the hashtag #HeartByrne. Attendees were treated to an outdoor dinner at the reception, where white tables were adorned with candles and green plants. The bar also had ‚ÄúBritt + Jeremy‚Äù across the front.

The bride and groom kissed as guests held up sparklers and also had some fun with the garter, with Byrne sticking his head under Nilsson‚Äôs dress as she laughed.

Nilsson, 30, revealed her engagement to her boyfriend of almost two years in May.

I prayed about it and I just knew, before we even met face to face!‚Äù Nilsson said about Byrne, who proposed with his great-grandmother‚Äôs ring. time: 2018-10-18 
 author: null 
 source: https://www.oprahmag.com/entertainment/tv-movies/a23853483/jada-pinkett-smith-red-table-talk-season-1-highlights/ 
 text: Our editors handpick the products that we feature. We may earn commission from the links on this page.

If you're unfamiliar with it, Jada Pinkett Smith's Red Table Talk is one of the realest talk shows streaming today. As the host, and with the help of her 17-year-old daughter, Willow, and her mother, Adrienne Banfield-Jones, Pinkett Smith comfortably covers juicy topics like sex, love, and family while also interviewing celebrities. And now that the trailer for the second season has dropped, we're anxiously waiting for it to return to Facebook Watch on October 22.

So how successful was the debut? The hit show is a finalist for the 2018 People's Choice Awards Daytime Talk Show category, and the new season promises major interviews with celebrities like Ellen Pompeo, Leah Remini, and the lead host's husband, Will Smith. In a sneak peak of her interview with Will, he reveals that there was a point in their relationship where she cried for 45 days straight. "It was every morning," he said. "I think that's the worst I've ever felt in our marriage."

But before we dive into the newest episodes, let's not forget the Red Table Talk moments that hooked us in the first place.

We learned that Tiffany Haddish had a date with Drake. And he canceled.

As one of Hollywood's busiest stars‚Äîshe's in four movies and one TV show this year‚ÄîHaddish doesn't have much time to date. But the man she did clear her schedule for? Aubrey Graham, a.k.a. Drake.

Related Story Tiffany Haddish Has the Most Unpredictable Talent

Haddish explained that the rapper asked her to dinner after they met on the set of his "Nice For What" music video earlier this year, which she's featured in. She said yes and proceeded to make time on her calendar. "I go get my mustache waxed, get my armpits waxed, got me a nice little dress," she told Pinkett Smith.

But as the two A-listers were texting back and forth, Haddish soon learned it wasn't meant to be. Turns out, Drake had a "family emergency." In Canada. But being the perfectly blunt comedian that we love, Haddish had the greatest reaction: "I was like, ‚ÄòOkay. Okay! I could have made $100,000 today, but I was trying to see what that D do. But all right!'"

And that Pinkett Smith may have been a little too into self-love.

By the age of nine, her grandmother taught her all about the wonders of masturbation. As Pinkett Smith said, "She didn't want me to fall into the hands of a man and, if he gave me pleasure, to think that that was him."

But once she further explored her sexuality as a teenager, things got a little out of hand after she learned how to give herself multiple orgasms: "I was abstaining from men. And I actually think I went through kind of an addiction, too with it‚Ä¶And then one day I was like, ‚ÄòEnough. You're having five orgasms a day.'"

She also revealed she's experienced hair loss.

In an episode titled "Body Confessionals!" she explained that the reason she almost exclusively wears a pixie cut isn't for style. One day as she was showering, handfuls of hair came out and she recalls "shaking with fear." She took multiple tests and no one could figure out what caused it, so she ended going for the big chop.

While Pinkett Smith once found it empowering to take care of her previously long 'do, she soon discovered that out of all the life losses she could experience, losing her mane was something she could handle. Now, she enjoys her short hair or rocks a head scarf, something she said makes her feel like a queen. "I watch the higher power take things everyday. And by golly, if the higher power wants to take your hair? That's it."

Willow admitted to self-harming as a pre-teen.

Willow Smith shocked both her mother and grandmother when she confessed to cutting herself following the success of her 2010 hit song, " ."

"I had just stopped doing singing lessons and I was kind of just in this gray area of, Who am I? Do I have a purpose? Is there anything I can do besides this?" she said. "I was just listening to a lot of dark music, and it was so crazy, and I was just plunged into this black hole."

Though it's been five years since she stopped, Willow had only told one friend, leaving her family completely in the dark up until the moment she revealed her story on camera. Her mom said she "had no idea." "I never talk about it because it was such a short, weird point in my life," Willow said. "But you have to pull yourself out of it."

Jaden Smith actually moved out when he was 15.

Pinkett Smith called it "one of the most heartbreaking moments" of her life. Back then, she thought her now 20-year-old son was mature enough to make it. And as the child of a celebrity power couple, it was what he felt he needed to do in order to live his life and find a personal identity. "Being in this lifestyle, in this world, is a bubble. He wanted out and I understood that," she said.

"It just makes you appreciate being at home, being with your parents, spending quality time with your family,‚Äù Jaden added. "You get out into the world and you just understand things.‚Äù

Willow caught her parents in the act.

Indeed a real-life nightmare, she walked in on her parents having sex. Explaining this to her mom Pinkett Smith, she said she was just going downstairs to get some juice. But as soon as she saw what was happening, she ran upstairs because she knew she had "overstepped a boundary. "It would be like if I walked in on you meditating. When mommy's meditating, don't get in her business," she said.

In addition, Pinkett Smith feels betrayed by Tupac's death.

She and the late rapper, Tupac Shakur, became fast friends when they met in high school at Baltimore School for the Arts. Pinkett Smith called them "inseparable," and his 1996 death was a huge loss.

"My upset is more anger because I feel that he left me," she said. " I know that that's not true, and it's a very selfish way to think about it, but I really did believe that he was gonna be here for the long run."

Willow called out the silver lining, explaining that the artist left behind a legacy that hasn't been ignored by the generations that came after him. "He's an icon and that was what he was meant to do," Pinkett Smith said.

Apparently, Gabrielle Union and Pinkett Smith squashed their beef.

After 17 years of tension, Union and Pinkett Smith finally put their feud to rest in an emotional face-to-face. The reconciliation came as a surprise to many because the two kept their issues out of the public eye. The kicker? They had been friendly acquaintances until one day, they just weren't. In fact, they couldn't pinpoint why they stopped speaking in the first place, which Pinkett Smith called "some petty ass s‚Äî."

Pinkett Smith also brought up Union's 2013 Essence Black Women in Hollywood speech, in which the actress publicly confessed to a past in which she willingly participated in Hollywood gossip, reveling in the negativity that it caused. Union said that she used to be "a troll," but has since recognized that tearing others down didn't make her life any better.

"I had to see myself clearly," Union said. "It's ugly, it's hard, it's painful to recognize that you are the common denominator for the vast majority of your problems...You have to mourn the death of who you thought you were."

232.input:
time: 2018-03-28 
 author: Nick Vadala 
 source: http://www.philly.com/philly/entertainment/celebrities/president-trump-calls-roseanne-barr-with-congrats-on-roseanne-reboots-ratings-win-20180329.html 
 text: Roseanne Barr's hit 90s sitcom Roseanne returned to television this week after going off the air in 1997, and its season debut was so successful that President Donald Trump called Barr to congratulate her on her success.

As the New York Times first reported, Trump called Barr on Wednesday, apparently impressed by the 18 million viewers Roseanne drew to ABC on Tuesday Night. The White House today confirmed the call with the Associated Press.

Barr, who co-created and stars in in the show, made a call herself to Good Morning America today to discuss her chat with Trump, and offered more details.

"We just kind of had a private conversation, but we talked about a lot of things," Barr said. "He was just happy for me. I've known him for a lot of years and he's done a lot of nice things for me over the years, and it's a friendly conversation about working, television, and ratings."

Barr added that Trump "really understands ratings and how they measure things," which has "been an interest of [Barr's] for a long time, too."

She attributed the enthusiastic reception for the Roseanne revival to the way the show treats relationships between people with different political views. As the new season opened, Barr's character had not spoken to her sister Jackie, played by Laurie Metcalf, since the 2016 election. (Like Barr, her character, Roseanne Conner, is a Trump supporter, while Metcalf's Jackie was for Hillary Clinton.) But they soon reconciled.

Advertisement

"The idea that people can agree to disagree is kind of missing from everything," Barr said. "Conflict resolution and agreeing to disagree are important things. That's what we need to do as a country ‚Äî figure out what we don't like and talk to each other and discuss how we're going to get it changed or fixed. I hope [the show] opens up civil conversation between people and not just mudslinging. We need to be more civilized than that."

Donald Trump Jr. had previously offered his congratulations on Twitter.

Earlier this week, Barr appeared on Jimmy Kimmel Live alongside co-star John Goodman to discuss the Roseanne reboot. During the interview, Kimmel told the actress that he was shocked over her vocal support for Trump because she is "a very socially liberal person in general." Barr responded to Kimmel by telling him to "zip that f‚Äì lip."

"I'm still the same. You all moved. You all went too f‚Äì far out, you lost everybody," she said. "A lot of us, no matter who we voted for, we don't want to see our president fail. Because we don't want [Vice President Mike] Pence. Are you f‚Äì kidding me? You want Pence? You want Pence for the freaking president? Well then, zip that f‚Äì lip."

Roseanne airs 8 p.m. Tuesdays on ABC.

233.input:
time: 2018-02-07 
 author: Cond√© Nast 
 source: https://www.vanityfair.com/hollywood/2018/02/this-is-us-mandy-moore-interview-jacks-death-rebecca-eulogy-season-2-episode-15 
 text: This post contains spoilers for This Is Us Season 2, Episode 15, ‚ÄúThe Car.‚Äù

If Tuesday night‚Äôs installment of This Is Us was difficult to watch, just imagine how tough it was for the cast to film it‚Äînot only for obvious reasons, but also due to one element that didn‚Äôt come across on screen. Mandy Moore, whose character delivered a simultaneously heartfelt and humorous eulogy for her late husband underneath his favorite tree, had to grapple not only with the immense emotional weight of the material, but with a seriously distracting nearby ruckus.

‚ÄúThe location we are shooting at was so loud,‚Äù Moore said with a laugh during a phone interview with V.F. Wednesday morning. ‚ÄúThere was so much traffic, and we were right by an airport, and so there were planes constantly landing.‚Äù Understandably, it took a bit of work for Moore to get out of her head into the monologue amid so many distractions. But she knew all too well how important this moment was: as she put it, Rebecca‚Äôs speech, delivered for an audience of just her and Jack‚Äôs three children, was ‚Äúa deliberate move on her part . . . to really honor their father; it was her own way for just the four of them to really eulogize him.‚Äù She wanted to honor that‚Äîand, with a little helpful sound editing, she did, delivering the emotional cornerstone of a crucial episode as the series moves forward from the crushing death of its patriarch.

Rebecca starts her eulogy by revealing something she and Jack had never told their children: ‚ÄúDid you know that when your father and I first got married, I wasn‚Äôt sure that I ever wanted to have kids? I mean, I figured I would eventually, but . . .‚Äù She trails off before jumping to a topic that doesn‚Äôt seem relevant‚Äîat first: ‚ÄúHe was the worst at movies. Wasn‚Äôt he? He was just the worst. I mean, as soon as a movie started, he would just figure out who would end up with who or who murdered who. Somehow he was always, always right. It was like he could see things before they happen. You know? I mean, he could see you three before you happened. Thank God he did.‚Äù

To Moore, this scene was a moment of tremendous strength for Rebecca, a grieving, newly single parent to three kids who saw their father as a superhero. She reassures her sons that neither one of them needs to become the new ‚Äúman of the house,‚Äù and insists to Kate that it‚Äôs not her fault Jack decided to go back into the house for the family dog‚Äîa decision that quite possibly sealed his fate.

‚ÄúI thought it was so eloquent,‚Äù Moore said, before crediting Rebecca‚Äôs sit-down with the doctor who delivered her children with fortifying her spirit. Their conversation, she said, ‚Äúreally showed her that she could be the type of parent that Jack was, and that she needed to be for these kids.‚Äù The words Rebecca says to Jack‚Äôs spirit under the tree‚Äî‚ÄùWe‚Äôre going to be O.K.‚Äù‚Äîbecame the mantra that helped her focus while filming.

As fans know, though Jack‚Äôs death has finally been revealed, Moore‚Äôs co-star Milo Ventimiglia is not going anywhere; there‚Äôs plenty of Jack‚Äôs story left to be told through flashbacks. Plus, Moore notes, ‚ÄúI don‚Äôt know if anything‚Äôs ever really behind us or in the rearview mirror with this show, because we‚Äôre consistently jumping around in time and there‚Äôs lots of stuff that we shoot that I have a feeling, when it doesn‚Äôt make it an episode, will be used further down the road in some other way.‚Äú She can confirm that we‚Äôre pretty much done with this particularly dark moment, but makes no promises that it won‚Äôt be examined again in the future.

One overarching theme of the past few episodes of This Is Us has been Rebecca‚Äôs quiet strength‚Äîa change of pace from past plotlines in which the Pearson kids seemed to under-appreciate and undervalue their mother. Increasingly, it seems they‚Äôre coming to realize just how much pain she shouldered for them‚Äîwhich has been a welcome development for Moore.

‚ÄúI‚Äôm not a mother, but just speaking from my own experience and observations, I feel like moms often are sort of relegated to that,‚Äù Moore said. ‚ÄúNot all the time, and that is sweeping generalization‚Äîbut I feel like moms often are underestimated. Because they do carry, in a lot of cases, so much of the heavy load in life. And I am glad that like the tide has sort of shifted in this season.‚Äù And while Jack might have been a superhero on the surface, Rebecca is very much his equal: ‚ÄúThey were such a duo and a unit,‚Äù Moore said, ‚ÄúAnd I love that she‚Äôs sort of getting her due now.‚Äù

time: 2018-01-11 
 author: Saba Hamedy 
 source: https://www.cnn.com/2018/01/12/politics/david-letterman-barack-obama-netflix-interview-malia-college-move-in/index.html 
 text: Story highlights Letterman's new series debuts on Netflix on January 12 Other scheduled guests on Letterman's show include George Clooney and Malala Yousafzai

Washington CNN ‚Äî

Former President Barack Obama opened up about taking his daughter Malia to college last year, telling host David Letterman he was ‚Äúbasically useless‚Äù during the entire move-in process.

‚ÄúMichelle, she had like a cleaning glove, one of those yellow ones, she‚Äôs scouring the bathroom,‚Äù Obama told Letterman in the first episode of his new Netflix series, ‚ÄúMy Next Guest Needs No Introduction.‚Äù ‚ÄúSasha ‚Ä¶ was helping make the bed and fold clothes ‚Ä¶ and I was basically useless.‚Äù

Malia started her undergraduate career at Harvard University last year, after a taking a gap year following her high school graduation. The former President and first lady were spotted helping her move into her dorm at the end of August 2017.

Obama went on to describe that his only task, delegated to him by his daughters, was to set up a desk lamp ‚Äì and even that proved to be difficult for the emotional father.

‚ÄúIt should have taken like five minutes or three minutes,‚Äù he joked. ‚ÄúIt had one of those wrenches ‚Ä¶ and it only had like four parts or something. I‚Äôm sitting there just toiling away at this thing, it‚Äôs taking half an hour. Meanwhile, Michelle‚Äôs finished scrubbing and she‚Äôs organizing closets. I was pretty pathetic.‚Äù

Still, he said he held it together until he and the former first lady were driving away from campus.

My Next Guest Needs No Introduction With David Letterman | Official Trailer [HD] | Netflix

‚ÄúWhat‚Äôs changed I think from when we were kids is technology,‚Äù Obama told Letterman. ‚ÄúSo I get home and she (Malia) knows I‚Äôm pathetic, so she‚Äôs texted me hearts, and, you know, so we are talking on a regular basis. When we were kids, you had to go down to the end of the hall of the dorm (to make a call).‚Äù

Obama likened the entire move-in experience to ‚Äúopen-heart surgery,‚Äù as he previously said in an interview with WDEL radio.

Letterman‚Äôs interview with Obama, which was about an hour long, debuts on Netflix Friday. Other scheduled guests on Letterman‚Äôs show include George Clooney, Malala Yousafzai, Jay-Z, Tina Fey and Howard Stern.

235.input:
time: null 
 author: null 
 source: https://www.kqed.org/pop/28206/how-amber-rose-became-an-unlikely-feminist-icon 
 text: Both are impossible to know, of course. Rose is, after all, an unforgettable-looking woman, one who had been making a name for herself as a video and print model before Kanye had even met her. (He went out of his way to get an introduction after her striking appearance in the "What Them Girls Like" video by Ludacris.) As it stands, it is true that real, paparazzi-level celebrity only arrived on Rose's doorstep when Kanye did, and then her relationship with Khalifa kept her in the spotlight as a trophy wife until their split in 2014. During this time, Rose tried her hand at everything from music and random reality TV guest spots, to a clothing line‚Äîall with limited success.

Rose appeared, for years, like a genetically-blessed celebrity girlfriend who had little to offer the world other than her stunning style and penchant for fueling gossip. So it's ironic that Rose seemingly only found her footing and her calling once she was single and after she'd been raked over the coals in public one too many times. In the last two years, Amber Rose hasn't just landed on her feet, she's strapped some spiky high-heeled boots on those suckers and trampled over every hater in her vicinity, in an unflinchingly defiant manner.

The shift started when she showed up to 2015's VMAs wearing a body suit covered in female-specific insults. At Rose's side was Blac Chyna wearing a matching dress. "GOLD DIGGER," "BITCH," "WHORE," "STRIPPER," "HOE," their outfits screamed back at a public all too accustomed to directing these slurs at famous women. It was a surprising nod to the feminist riot grrrl movement of the 1990s‚Äîand a stark message that Amber Rose was not going to be shamed out of the way.

Later that year she penned a book, How to Be a Bad Bitch, which sold well. It preached a message of sisterhood, self-acceptance, strength and‚Äîin direct contradiction to the title of the thing‚Äîgood manners. It wasn't a flawlessly written feminist tome, but it did throw a couple of middle fingers at a media that is all too fond of pitting women against one another.

Then there was the pi√®ce de r√©sistance: the Amber Rose SlutWalk. Rose didn't invent the SlutWalk, but she has become an important spokesperson for the reasons why we need them. The one she held in Los Angeles in October 2015 was widely reported on in a way that others are not, precisely because she was at the helm, and precisely because she used it as a platform to speak very openly, and emotionally, about her life experiences and the double standards all women face. Photos of the event show her holding signs that read "FUCK YO 30 SHOWERS" and "STRIPPERS HAVE FEELINGS TOO."

The website accompanying the SlutWalk now serves as a space for women to share their own stories of sexist abuse and slut-shaming, and prides itself on being ‚Äúa completely inclusive space‚Äù with ‚Äúa zero tolerance policy on all hateful language, racism, sexism, ableism, fat-shaming, transphobia, or any other kind of bigotry.‚Äù

The impact has been sizeable, and Rose has since found herself appearing in sketches for both Inside Amy Schumer and Funny or Die that were equal parts hilarious and subversive.

Funny or Die's "Walk of No Shame With Amber Rose" was, in particular, gloriously sex positive:

In addition to all of this, Rose has become a voice for other celebrity women. Just last week, she came to Taylor Swift's aid, when the singer (another woman on the receiving end of Kanye West's wrath‚Äî"I made that bitch famous" he raps in "Famous") was under scrutiny for having a new love interest.

236.input:
time: 2018-01-31 
 author: Cond√© Nast 
 source: https://www.vanityfair.com/hollywood/2018/01/dumbledore-fantastic-beasts-explicitly-gay 
 text: When the cast for Fantastic Beasts: The Crimes of Grindelwald was first announced, with Jude Law set to play a younger, hotter Dumbledore, fans grew excited, imagining boundless possibilities for this dashing new version of the character. Could the film, perhaps, even include a glimpse at the future Hogwarts headmaster‚Äôs romantic life‚Äîa subject left open-ended by the original Harry Potter books, though J.K. Rowling confirmed after completing the series that Dumbledore was gay?

Well, no. Director David Yates has revealed that for now, Dumbledore‚Äôs sexuality will not make it to screen‚Äîat least, ‚Äúnot explicitly.‚Äù

‚ÄúBut I think all the fans are aware of that,‚Äù Yates continued, speaking to Entertainment Weekly. ‚ÄúHe had a very intense relationship with Grindelwald when they were young men. They fell in love with each other‚Äôs ideas, and ideology, and each other.‚Äù

Rowling previously teased the idea that eventually, one of the five planned Fantastic Beasts films will address Dumbledore‚Äôs sexuality‚Äîbut it‚Äôs unclear when, or how. ‚ÄúWell, I can‚Äôt tell you everything I would like to say because this is obviously a five-part story, so there‚Äôs lots to unpack in that relationship,‚Äù she said at a press conference in 2016. ‚ÄúI will say that you will see Dumbledore as a younger man, and quite a troubled man because he wasn‚Äôt always the sage. He was always very clever, but we‚Äôll see what I think was the formative period of his life. As far as his sexuality is concerned, watch the space.‚Äù Rowling responded to the recent controversy on Twitter, complaining that she‚Äôd been ‚Äúsent abuse about an interview that didn't involve me, about a screenplay I wrote but which none of the angry people have read, which is part of a five-movie series that's only one instalment in.‚Äù

What, exactly, are fans to make of this? Rowling first announced that Dumbledore was gay in 2007, while promoting the final book in her original series, Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows. As she put it to one fan who asked if Dumbledore had ever fallen in love, ‚ÄúI always thought of Dumbledore as gay.‚Äù Three Harry Potter films were released after this announcement, but none of them made explicit mention of Dumbledore‚Äôs sexuality‚Äîunderstandably, perhaps, since their source material didn‚Äôt either. As of now, Dumbledore‚Äôs romantic life has been purely the stuff of fan fiction‚Äîand apparently, it will remain so for the foreseeable future.

This approach speaks to a frustrating trend in blockbuster movies, one exemplified by recent films like Power Rangers and Beauty and the Beast. Both movies made headlines by teasing story lines involving explicitly gay characters‚Äîor, in the case of Beauty and the Beast, an ‚Äúexclusively gay moment.‚Äù When the movies actually made it to theaters, though, those much-touted scenes amounted to little more than throwaway moments that felt divorced from the rest of the story‚Äîblink-and-you‚Äôll-miss-it fragments, rather than true examples of much-needed L.G.B.T. representation. There‚Äôs something cynical about explicitly telling L.G.B.T. fans to look out for L.G.B.T. characters‚Äîthen responding to their attention (and ticket purchases) with weak feints at inclusion, or nothing at all.

Although TV continues to make great strides in this arena, film has lagged far behind‚Äîand few franchises make that more readily apparent than Fantastic Beasts. Obviously, it‚Äôs wrong to write a film off without having seen it‚Äîbut at the same time, it‚Äôs only natural for some fans to feel disappointment at this Dumbledore news. Legions of moviegoers are tired of being teased with the possibility of L.G.B.T. characters, only to have the prospect unceremoniously yanked out from under them. The first Fantastic Beasts already hinged on an obvious gay liberation metaphor involving Ezra Miller‚Äôs character, Credence. Why, then, should it bother being coy about Dumbledore‚Äôs personal life‚Äîespecially in a film that essentially pits the character against his terrible ex-boyfriend?

Marketing divisions seem to have figured out already that representation often helps a film‚Äôs bottom line; how long will it take for writers and filmmakers to follow suit?

237.input:
time: 2018-04-16 
 author: Taylor Weatherby 
 source: https://www.billboard.com/articles/columns/country/8338262/acm-awards-2018-what-you-didnt-see-on-tv 
 text: The 2018 ACM Awards are officially wrapped, putting another star-studded night of country music in the books. Starting with a touching tribute to those who lost their lives and were affected by the Route 91 Harvest Festival shooting in October and ending with a heartfelt speech from entertainer of the year winner Jason Aldean, this year‚Äôs Las Vegas-based ACMs were particularly bittersweet ‚Äî yet, there was nothing but positive energy all around as country‚Äôs biggest stars embodied #VegasStrong.

Billboard was on the red carpet and inside the show Sunday night (April 15) to catch the happenings that weren‚Äôt shown in the live broadcast . Check out some of the action we caught below.

Related Here Are All the Winners From the 2018 ACM Awards

3:40 p.m. Cam and pop singer Bebe Rexha, who crashed the ACMs to perform ‚ÄúMeant To Be,‚Äù her massive hit with Florida Georgia Line, embrace on the red carpet, reuniting after hanging together at ‚ÄúAmerican Idol, The Macy‚Äôs Thanksgiving Day Parade, and March For Our Lives.

4:15 p.m. Midland, Jon Pardi and the Brothers Osborne admire each other‚Äôs sparkling outfits on the red carpet. ‚ÄúI‚Äôm jelly,‚Äù declared Jon Osborne of Pardi‚Äôs white, sparkly jacket, complete with flowers, instruments, and, touchingly, a tribute to the 58 fans who were killed in the Route 91 Festival massacre with ‚ÄúHonor 58‚Äù emblazoned on the sleeve. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs very bedazzly,‚Äù Pardi said, of his jacket. ‚ÄúWe‚Äôre Rhinestone Central,‚Äú added Midland‚Äôs Mark Wystrach.

5:02 p.m. PT Jason Aldean takes his time walking off stage to head to his seat after the opening Route 91 tribute, waving to fans as he makes his way to his seat.

5:04 p.m. After Reba McEntire takes a shot at former ACM co-hosts Blake Shelton and Luke Bryan saying ‚ÄúOne women can do the job of two men, ‚ÄúBlake Shelton and Luke Bryan come together to holler at this year‚Äôs host.

5:08 p.m. Kenny Chesney shoots a friendly point across the arena to Reba before the camera goes on him for his first televised performance of ‚ÄúGet Along.‚Äù

5:18 p.m. Chris Young gives hugs to a few folks on his way out from his stripped-down performance of ‚ÄúLosing Sleep.‚Äù

5:20 p.m. Julia Michaels snaps a picture with Miranda Lambert and Keith Urban during the first commercial break.

5:22 p.m. Florida Georgia Line waves to fans as they take their places and Tyler Hubbard busts a move to get amped for their performance of ‚ÄúMeant To Be‚Äù with Bebe Rexha.

5:28 p.m. New male vocalist of the year winner Brett Young applauds Miranda Lambert for winning song of the year for ‚ÄúTin Man‚Äù and turns to watch the acceptance speech as he waits for his performance of ‚ÄúIn Case You Didn‚Äôt Know.‚Äù

5:33 p.m. Keith Urban starts to make his rounds of catching up with his fellow superstars, chatting with Luke Bryan and his wife and snapping a couples pic with his wife Nicole Kidman during the second commercial break.

5:36 p.m. Reba does a quick dance before she resumes her hosting duties.

5:38 p.m. Alan Jackson gets the crowd the most electric yet, getting them on their feet to dance along to his performance of ‚ÄúChattahoochee‚Äù with Jon Pardi.

5:46 p.m. Jake Owen was one of the first to his feet after Lady Antebellum‚Äòs gripping performance of ‚ÄúHeart Break,‚Äù looking around like ‚Äúthat was f-ing awesome!‚Äù

5:50 p.m. Dierks Bentley takes his seat right after going to his wife during his performance of ‚ÄúWoman, Amen,‚Äù hi-fiving Luke Bryan about their hilarious onscreen moment.

6:02 p.m. Lauren Alaina gives Kane Brown a huge hug after they finish introducing the ACM Lifting Lives video that followed their performance of ‚ÄúWhat Ifs.‚Äù

6:14 p.m. Keith Urban excitedly swings his guitar in the air to celebrate his performance with Julia Michaels on their duet ‚ÄúComing Home,‚Äù which makes her jump while laughing at the close call. As the two make their way off stage, Michaels swings her arm around Urban.

6:21 p.m. Kelsea Ballerini runs through her performance with herself quickly before cameras roll, taking a deep breath as the floating heart she started her ‚ÄúI Hate Love Songs‚Äù performance in moves her up in the air. After finishing the full performance, she jumps up and down with her hands up and high fives her band.

6:42 p.m. Midland frontman Mark Wystrach passionately sings along to Little Big Town‚Äôs rendition of Elton John‚Äôs ‚ÄúRocket Man‚Äù while they get ready to perform their own hit ‚ÄúDrinkin‚Äô Problem.‚Äù

6:54 p.m. Keith Urban chats it up with Florida Georgia line in their first and second row seats in between segments of the show.

7:09 p.m. RaeLynn sees some people she knows as she walks around the floor, doing a little get down when she sees one friend in particular.

7:21 p.m. Thomas Rhett‚Äòs wife Lauren Akins sings and sways along to his performance of ‚ÄúMarry Me,‚Äù and they give a little cute point to each other after he‚Äôs done with the song.

7:32 p.m. Luke Bryan fist bumps his band as soon as cameras go off of him after his performance of ‚ÄúMost People Are Good.‚Äù

7:35 p.m. The news that Sam Hunt wasn‚Äôt in attendance to accept his single record of the year award for ‚ÄúBody Like A Back Road‚Äù resulted in a slew of disappointed ‚Äúawws‚Äù from the audience.

7:37 p.m. Lauren Alaina spots her boyfriend Alex Hopkins across the room after she finishes her ‚ÄúDoin‚Äô Fine‚Äù performance and they excitedly point at each other as he sends a congratulatory kiss her way.

7:44 p.m. Kelly Clarkson gets in her presenting position before her performance with Reba McEntire by, of course, doing a little dance.

7:59 p.m. Chris Janson‚Äòs performance gets everyone on their feet, but gets Keith Urban and Nicole Kidman particularly pumped as they throw their fists in the air as he finishes. LOCASH‚Äòs Preston Brust may have been the most excited of them all, though, as he stood on his seat to applaud the rocking show closer.

time: 2017-02-14 
 author: Amber Belus 
 source: www.intouchweekly.com/posts/tom-cruise-mom-died-katie-holmes-125460 
 text: Tom Cruise received the devastating news last week that his mom, Mary Lee South, died at age 80 ‚Äî and now a new report claims that his ex Katie Holmes decided to be there for the father of her child.

‚ÄúKatie Holmes has reached out to her ex Tom Cruise to offer her condolences after the passing of his mother,‚Äù a source told [Hollywood Life](http://hollywoodlife.com/2017/02/13/katie-holmes-tom-cruise-mom-dies-condolences-loss-mary-lee-south/?utmsource=social&utmcampaign=partner-bauer&utmmedium=social)_. ‚ÄúTom has been rocked by the loss of his mother. They were very close and he will miss her dearly. He is staying strong and leaning on close friends and other family during this challenging time.‚Äù

MORE: Suri Cruise Is All Grown Up ‚Äî See the Pic

According to reports, Mary died peacefully in her sleep and was sent off with a Scientology ceremony. She was also the one who encouraged Tom to pursue an acting career.

Tom and Katie tied the knot in November 2006 and ended their marriage in August 2012. They are also parents to a 10-year-old daughter, Suri ‚Äî though Tom hasn‚Äôt seen her in quite some time.

‚ÄúThey used to Skype and text, but that trailed off drastically. He uses his film commitments as an excuse, but the truth is that doesn‚Äôt hold much weight with Suri anymore,‚Äù a source previously told In Touch. ‚ÄúTom eats, breathes and sleeps Scientology. He‚Äôs disconnected from Katie, and then de facto from Suri, because of her connection to Katie. He hasn‚Äôt seen her since she was seven.‚Äù

Katie moved on from the relationship with actor Jamie Foxx, and they were recently spotted spending New Year‚Äôs Eve together in Miami.

‚ÄúThey‚Äôre very serious,‚Äù said a source.

Meanwhile, Tom was recently rumored to be dating a British woman.

MORE: Enter Here for Your Chance to Win a Trip to Miami

We think it‚Äôs great that these two can still lean on each other in the most difficult times ‚Äî and hope this could lead to him reconnecting with his daughter.

Our thoughts are with Mary‚Äôs loved ones in the wake of this tragedy.

time: 2018-02-21 
 author: Ni√±a V. Guno 
 source: https://entertainment.inquirer.net/262847/p2fb-will-says-fergie-black-eyed-peas-nicole-scherzinger-new-member 
 text: https://www.instagram.com/p/BfbKUCNHGI7/?hl=en&taken-by=bep

It doesn‚Äôt seem to be Fergie‚Äôs week.

Following criticism of her national anthem performance on the NBA All-Star Game, now the singer, real name Stacy Ann Ferguson, is said to be out of hip-hop group Black Eyed Peas (BEP).

ADVERTISEMENT

https://www.instagram.com/p/BeY97dAgYJN/?taken-by=fergie

Black Eyed Peas founding member will.i.am (William James Adams) told the Daily Star that Fergie is not on the group‚Äôs seventh studio album.

‚ÄúWe are now a trio. I don‚Äôt know why Fergie isn‚Äôt on the project. You will have to ask Fergie that,‚Äù he said.

The other members of the group which formed in 1995 are apl.de.ap (Allan Pineda) and Taboo (Jaime Luis Gomez). Fergie joined them in 2002.

Adams revealed that the group has a WhatsApp group chat called ‚ÄúBlack Eyed Peas family‚Äù which Fergie isn‚Äôt a part of. However, Pussycat Dolls lead singer Nicole Sherzinger is in it.

https://www.instagram.com/p/BZ46BRnBfpv/?hl=en&taken-by=nicolescherzy

‚ÄúIt has nothing to do with making music or money. It‚Äôs about friendship,‚Äù explained Adams of the group chat, not mentioning if they will be working with her. They did consider her as a member in the early 2000s, but she had to decline for another project.

ADVERTISEMENT

He also said there‚Äôs no news from Scherzinger if the Pussycat Dolls will make a comeback.

After finding success with Black Eyed Peas, Fergie went solo in 2006, then worked with the group in 2009. She began working on her second solo album ‚ÄúDouble Dutchess‚Äù in 2013 and released it in September 2017.

In June 2017, rumors circulated that Fergie had left the group. She and Adams both clarified that she was still in it but that she was focusing on her new solo album.

Black Eyed Peas‚Äô hits with Fergie include ‚ÄúWhere Is the Love‚Äù, ‚ÄúMy Humps‚Äù and ‚ÄúI Gotta Feeling‚Äù. The group sans Fergie released its first single in seven years last January titled ‚ÄúStreet Livin‚Äô‚Äù. Ni√±a V. Guno/JB

 text: Halle Berry is putting her Hollywood peers on blast who publicly say they support movements like Black Lives Matter and are sick of the racial unrest in America but do nothing to spark a change.

According to Page Six, while speaking at the Cannes Lions Girls' Lounge event, the Oscar-winning actress said she's "tired" of the complaining.

"In my world, I get so tired of people complaining about, 'Oh, Black lives matter,' and they pontificate and pontificate about it, and I say, 'Well, what are you doing about that? It may not seem significant to you, but that's how we start. Have you called your local politicians? Have you written a letter?"

Speaking on how she specifically addresses these people, she added, "When they say they've done nothing, I say, 'Well, don't talk to me... because you are part of the problem because you are sitting here spewing negativity and complaining.'"

She ended with these words: "I don't have time for people who talk the talk but don't walk the walk."

The celebrated actress has been overseas taking meetings at Cannes Lions, collaborating with tech and marketing firms as she prepares to relaunch her website and social media platform, Hallewood.
